category: Punctuation Marks with Common Alternate Meanings
explanation: All tokens except 'Semicolon' are punctuation marks that also have a distinct and common meaning as an unrelated noun or verb (e.g., 'Period' as a duration, 'Comma' as a state of unconsciousness, 'Colon' as an organ, 'Dash' as a quick movement). 'Semicolon' primarily refers only to the punctuation mark itself.

category: Pioneers Whose Demise Was Linked to Their Work
explanation: Marie Curie, Alexander Bogdanov, Karl Scheele, and Henry Winstanley all died as a direct consequence of their pioneering scientific or engineering work or creations. Galileo Galilei died of natural causes (illness) while under house arrest, though his persecution was a result of his scientific beliefs, his death was not a direct physical consequence of his work or inventions.

Fairy, Ghost, War, and Love can all precede "story" to denote a specific, recognized genre or type of narrative (Fairy Tale/Story, Ghost Story, War Story, Love Story). "True" describes the veracity of a story, not a genre.
